requirement_groups.title: Units required for Professional Accounting Accreditation
requirement_groups.description:
If you are seeking membership to ACCA, CA ANZ or CPA you should complete the following units. These units will need to be completed in Part C Free elective study.

ACX3900 must be completed as the course capstone unit.

DOUBLE DEGREE: Please note, if you are completing the Accounting major as part of your double degree, ECX2953 is required for professional accreditation and can be completed instead of ECB1101 in Part A.

Note: For the Accountancy major, the completion of some units within the major entitles exemptions from enrolling in similar papers in the professional qualifying exams set by the accounting professional bodies. Where you have not completed a unit that carries an exemption, you are unlikely to be granted an exemption by the professional bodies.

requirement_groups.title: Students enrolled in a double degree with Engineering
requirement_groups.description: The 36 credit points of specialisation technical electives, which are typically required in the single degree Engineering course, have already been credited towards the double degree structure. As a result, these units are not a requirement in the double degree courses.

requirement_groups.title: Aerospace engineering technical electives
requirement_groups.description:
When choosing your electives, it is important to select only from your specialisation technical electives list. This ensures that your elective studies align with and contribute to the knowledge and skills required within your chosen field of study. However, there are additional options available to you:

Option 1: You may use your electives to complete a complementary engineering minor that is available with your specialisation. This allows you to further enhance your knowledge and skills in a specific area of engineering that complements your main field of study.

Option 2: You may consider engineering technical units listed across the engineering minors, subject to meeting the unit prerequisite or co-requisite rules. This will allow you to tailor your studies and broaden your knowledge within the field of engineering while still aligning with your chosen specialisation.

Note: To enrol in a Level 5 unit listed below, you must be in your final year and have a weighted average mark (WAM) of 65 or above at the conclusion of 3rd Year.

requirement_groups.title: Students enrolled in the single degree Engineering
requirement_groups.description:
To satisfy course requirements, you must take care to complete the electives at the required unit level.

In Year 2, you must complete 12 credit points of electives which can be Level 1, 2 or 3 units from Engineering or other faculties, subject to meeting the unit enrolment rules. Please ensure that you adhere to the course rules regarding Level 1 units and do not exceed the maximum 60 credit points allowed.

In Years 3 and 4, you must complete 24 credit points of electives which must be Level 3 or 4 units and from your engineering specialisation technical electives list. You may also enrol in up to two Level 5 units in your final year. If you intend to enrol in the Faculty's Master of Engineering post-graduate, completing Level 5 units that are core in the Master's course will reduce the total duration of your Master's study.

requirement_groups.description: Complete all requirements for Chemical engineering

requirement_groups.title: Part D. Professional practice
requirement_groups.description:
Continuous professional development is a crucial part of meeting the Engineers Australia Stage 1 Competency Standard to be a Professional Engineer. You must enrol in ENG0001 in your final year and satisfy the professional development requirements if you are studying at the Clayton campus.

The Engineering Accreditation Council Malaysia have similar industrial training requirements. You must enrol in ENG0002 in the second semester of your third year and complete the industrial training required if you are studying at the Malaysia campus.

requirement_groups.title: E3008 Bachelor of Engineering (Honours)/Bachelor of Pharmaceutical Science - IMPORTANT INFORMATION
requirement_groups.description: Due to overlapping contents with BPS1031/BPS1032, you must replace CHM1011/CHM1051 with one unit selected from below.

requirement_groups.title: Professional Practice domain
requirement_groups.description: You must complete one of the following professional practice domain units

requirement_groups.title: Optional industry project
requirement_groups.description: CHE4164 and CHE4165 combine to provide a year-long industry experience project only for select students in their final year. The units are in place of the two core final year project units ENG4701 and ENG4702.

requirement_groups.title: Part C. Chemical engineering knowledge and application
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete the core chemical engineering units below AND one unit selected from the Professional Practice domain suite (totalling 108 credit points).

Note 1: If you complete CHM1011, CHM1051 or CHE2161 as a First Year breadth study unit, it will count towards your chemical engineering study. You must still fulfil the First Year engineering breadth study requirement by completing another breadth study unit.

Note 2: If you are studying E3008 Engineering and Pharmaceutical Science double degree course, you will not complete CHM1011/CHM1051. Please refer to the information below for the specific replacement unit.

requirement_groups.title: Industry 4.0
requirement_groups.description: Industry 4.0 refers to the fourth industrial revolution that is giving rise to the transformative digital industrial technologies connecting the physical world with the digital world. You are encouraged to select ECE2071, ECE2131 and TRC3500 in your electives if you are seeking to broaden your skills needed for the jobs of the future.

requirement_groups.title: Chemical engineering technical electives
requirement_groups.description:
When choosing your electives, it is important to select only from your specialisation technical electives list. This ensures that your elective studies align with and contribute to the knowledge and skills required within your chosen field of study. However, there are additional options available to you:

Option 1: You may use your electives to complete a complementary engineering minor that is available with your specialisation. This allows you to further enhance your knowledge and skills in a specific area of engineering that complements your main field of study.

Option 2: You may consider engineering technical units listed across the engineering minors, subject to meeting the unit prerequisite or co-requisite rules. This will allow you to tailor your studies and broaden your knowledge within the field of engineering while still aligning with your chosen specialisation.

Note: To enrol in a Level 5 unit listed below, you must be in your final year and have a weighted average mark (WAM) of 65 or above at the conclusion of 3rd Year.

requirement_groups.title: Students enrolled in the single degree Engineering
requirement_groups.description:
To satisfy course requirements, you must take care to complete the electives at the required unit level.

In Year 2, you must complete 12 credit points of electives which can be Level 1, 2 or 3 units from Engineering or other faculties, subject to meeting the unit enrolment rules. Please ensure that you adhere to the course rules regarding Level 1 units and do not exceed the maximum 60 credit points allowed.

In Years 3 and 4, you must complete 24 credit points of electives which must be Level 3 or 4 units and from your engineering specialisation technical electives list. You may also enrol in up to two Level 5 units in your final year. If you intend to enrol in the Faculty's Master of Engineering post-graduate, completing Level 5 units that are core in the Master's course will reduce the total duration of your Master's study.

requirement_groups.title: Students enrolled in a double degree with Engineering
requirement_groups.description: The 36 credit points of specialisation technical electives, which are typically required in the single degree Engineering course, have already been credited towards the double degree structure. As a result, these units are not a requirement in the double degree courses.

requirement_groups.description: Complete all requirements for Climate and atmospheric science

requirement_groups.title: Climate change science stream
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete three units (18 credit points), noting that at least two of these additional units (12 credit points) must be Level 3.
Note: You can only complete one of EAE2011 and EAE2111 (the unit not completed as part of the core).

requirement_groups.title: Weather and climate stream
requirement_groups.description: You must complete three units (18 credit points), noting that there is a choice listed for the third unit (you can only complete one of EAE3051 and EAE3132).

requirement_groups.title: Elective units
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete 18 credit points from the following list or one of the two streams listed below, noting that at least two of these additional units (12 credit points) must be Level at 3.

Note 1: You can only complete one of EAE2011 and EAE2111 (the unit not completed as part of the core).

Note 2: EAE3121 and EAE3152 have mathematics prerequisites. They both rely on the successful completion of MTH1030 and MTH2010.

Students in the double degree E3007 Bachelor of Engineering (Honours) and Bachelor of Science complete ENG1090 and/or ENG1005 instead of MTH1020 and/or MTH1030 and ENG2005 instead of MTH2010. Those in Software Engineering specialisation complete ENG1005 and MTH2010.

requirement_groups.title: Core units
requirement_groups.description:

Note: You can only complete one of EAE2011 and EAE2111. EAE2111 is recommended if MTH1030 has been completed.

requirement_groups.title: CLATMSCI02 - Complete Requirements
requirement_groups.description: Complete all requirements for Climate and atmospheric science

requirement_groups.title: Additional climate and atmospheric science units
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete 12 credit points from the following units.

Note 1: You can only complete one of EAE2011 and EAE2111.

Note 2: EAE3121 and EAE3152 have mathematics prerequisites. They both rely on the successful completion of MTH1030 and MTH2010. Noting that these two units have the following special enrolment rules:

MTH1030: You must have passed MTH1020 with a mark of at least 60 or VCE Specialist Mathematics units 3 and 4 with a raw study score of at least 30. Exceptions for students who passed MTH1020 with a mark in the range of 50 to 59 can be made with permission from the unit coordinator based on a diagnostic test.

MTH2010: Students must have passed MTH1030, MTH1035, or MTH1040 with a mark of at least 60. Exceptions for students who passed these units with a mark in the range of 50 to 59 can be made with permission from the unit co-coordinator based on a diagnostic test.

Students in the double degree E3007 Bachelor of Engineering (Honours) and Bachelor of Science complete ENG1090 and/or ENG1005 instead of MTH1020 and/or MTH1030 and ENG2005 instead of MTH2010. Those in Software Engineering specialisation; ENG1005 and MTH2010.

requirement_groups.title: Core units
requirement_groups.description: You must complete the following units

all_units.EAE2122: Introduction to atmospheric physics and dynamics
all_units.EAE1011: The Earth system: From the core to the atmosphere
all_units.EAE1022: The Earth system: Changing environments and climates

requirement_groups.title: Core units
requirement_groups.description:

requirement_groups.title: Weather and climate stream
requirement_groups.description: You must complete 18 credit points, noting that there is a choice listed for the third unit (you can only complete one of EAE3051 and EAE3132).

requirement_groups.title: Climate change science stream
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete 18 credit points, noting that at least two of these additional units (12 credit points) must be at Level 3.

requirement_groups.title: Elective Units
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete 18 credit points from the following list or one of the two streams listed below, noting that at least two of these additional units (12 credit points) must be at Level 3.

Note 1: You can only complete one of EAE2011 and EAE2111 (the unit not completed as part of the core).

Note 2: EAE3121 and EAE3152 have mathematics prerequisites. They both rely on the successful completion of MTH1030 and MTH2010.

Students in the double degree E3007 Bachelor of Engineering (Honours) and Bachelor of Science complete ENG1090 and/or ENG1005 instead of MTH1020 and/or MTH1030 and ENG2005 instead of MTH2010. Those in Software Engineering specialisation complete ENG1005 and MTH2010.

requirement_groups.title: Part B. Expert studies in education
requirement_groups.description: You must complete the following units, and 12 credit points of approved Level 5 units from select Faculty of Education graduate coursework programs (see above link).

requirement_groups.title: Pathway to graduate research (optional)
requirement_groups.description:
A pathway to graduate research (e.g. master by research, PhD) is available if you achieve a weighted average mark of at least 75% in the units of this course.

If you are completing this pathway, you will need to make the following unit substitutions:
EDF5613 Research approaches in education (12 credit points) to replace EDF5766 Shaping digital futures (12 credit points) (Part B);
EDF5614 Research project in education (12 credit points) to replace 12 credit points of approved Level 5 units from select Faculty of Education graduate coursework programs (Part C).

Note: This pathway is not available at the point of entry; your eligibility to undertake this pathway will be checked prior to the commencement of EDF5613;
if you are commencing at entry level 1 or 2, you must take the required two units in the final semester of your studies; and if you are commencing at entry level 3, you must transfer into the general education studies specialisation.

If you are completing this pathway, you must complete the following units.

all_units.EDF5610: Interacting with research in education contexts
all_units.EDF5611: Investigating education issues in global contexts
all_units.EDF5647: Technology and education: Key issues and debates

requirement_groups.title: Pathway to graduate research (optional)
requirement_groups.description:
A pathway to graduate research (e.g. master by research, PhD) is available if you achieve a weighted average mark (WAM) of at least 75% in the units of this course.

If you are completing this pathway, you will need to make the following unit substitutions:
EDF5613 Research approaches in education (12 credit points) to replace EDF5773 Global leaders in early childhood education (12 credit points) (Part B)
EDF5614 Research project in education (12 credit points) to replace 12 credit points of approved Level 5 units from select Faculty of Education graduate coursework programs (Part C)

Please note: this pathway is not available at the point of entry; your eligibility to undertake this pathway will be checked prior to the commencement of EDF5613; if you are commencing at entry level 1 or 2, you must take the required two units in the final semester of your studies; and if you are commencing at entry level 3, you must transfer into the general education studies specialisation.

If you are completing this pathway, you must complete the following units.

requirement_groups.description: You must complete the following units

requirement_groups.title: Part B. Expert studies in education
requirement_groups.description: You must complete 12 credit points of approved Level 5 units from select Faculty of Education graduate coursework programs (see above link) AND the units listed below.

all_units.EDF5611: Investigating education issues in global contexts

all_units.EDF5774: Building STEM learning communities in early childhood
all_units.EDF5775: Advanced play and pedagogy in early childhood settings

requirement_groups.title: Part C. Electrical and computer systems engineering knowledge and application
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete the 15 core electrical and computer systems engineering units below, two ECE-coded units at Level 4 or 5 selected from the core electives list below AND one unit selected from the Professional Practice domain suite (totalling 108 credit points).

Note: If you complete ECE2072 as a First Year breadth study unit, it will count towards your electrical and computer systems engineering study. You must still fulfil the First Year engineering breadth study requirement by completing another breadth study unit.

requirement_groups.title: Electrical and computer systems engineering technical electives
requirement_groups.description:
When choosing your electives, it is important to select only from your specialisation technical electives list. This ensures that your elective studies align with and contribute to the knowledge and skills required within your chosen field of study. However, there are additional options available to you:

Option 1: You may use your electives to complete a complementary engineering minor that is available with your specialisation. This allows you to further enhance your knowledge and skills in a specific area of engineering that complements your main field of study.

Option 2: You may consider engineering technical units listed across the engineering minors, subject to meeting the unit prerequisite or co-requisite rules. This will allow you to tailor your studies and broaden your knowledge within the field of engineering while still aligning with your chosen specialisation.

Note: To enrol in a Level 5 unit listed below, you must be in your final year and have a weighted average mark (WAM) of 65 or above at the conclusion of 3rd Year.

requirement_groups.title: Students enrolled in the single degree Engineering
requirement_groups.description:
To satisfy course requirements, you must take care to complete the electives at the required unit level.

In Year 2, you must complete 12 credit points of electives which can be Level 1, 2 or 3 units from Engineering or other faculties, subject to meeting the unit enrolment rules. Please ensure that you adhere to the course rules regarding Level 1 units and do not exceed the maximum 60 credit points allowed.

In Years 3 and 4, you must complete 24 credit points of electives which must be Level 3 or 4 units and from your engineering specialisation technical electives list. You may also enrol in up to two Level 5 units in your final year. If you intend to enrol in the Faculty's Master of Engineering post-graduate, completing Level 5 units that are core in the Master's course will reduce the total duration of your Master's study.

requirement_groups.title: Students enrolled in a double degree with Engineering
requirement_groups.description: The 36 credit points of specialisation technical electives, which are typically required in the single degree Engineering course, have already been credited towards the double degree structure. As a result, these units are not a requirement in the double degree courses.

requirement_groups.title: Part D. Professional practice
requirement_groups.description:
Continuous professional development is a crucial part of meeting the Engineers Australia Stage 1 Competency Standard to be a Professional Engineer. You must enrol in ENG0001 in your final year and satisfy the professional development requirement if you are studying at the Clayton campus.

The Engineering Accreditation Council Malaysia have similar industrial training requirements. You must enrol in ENG0002 in the second semester of your third year and complete the industrial training required if you are studying at the Malaysia campus.

requirement_groups.title: GENEDSTU01 - Complete Requirements
requirement_groups.description: Complete all requirements for General education studies

requirement_groups.title: Pathway to graduate research (optional)
requirement_groups.description:
A pathway to graduate research (e.g. master by research, PhD) is available if you achieve a weighted average mark (WAM) of at least 75% in the units of this course.

If you are completing this pathway, you will need to make the following unit substitutions: EDF5613 Research approaches in education (12 credit points) to replace EDF5760 Action research in contemporary educational contexts (12 credit points) (Part B); EDF5614 Research project in education (12 credit points) to replace 12 credit points of approved Level 5 units from select Faculty of Education graduate coursework programs (Part C).

Note: This pathway is not available at the point of entry; your eligibility to undertake this pathway will be checked prior to the commencement of EDF5613; if you are commencing at entry level 1 or 2, you must take the required two units in the final semester of your studies.

If you are completing this pathway, you must complete the following units.

requirement_groups.title: Part B. Expert studies in education
requirement_groups.description: You must complete the following units, and 12 credit points of approved Level 5 units from select Faculty of Education graduate coursework programs (see above link).

requirement_groups.title: Part A. Orientation to education
requirement_groups.description: You must complete the following units

requirement_groups.title: Part C. Professional inquiry
requirement_groups.description: You must complete the following units, and 12 credit points of approved Level 5 units from select Faculty of Education graduate coursework programs.

all_units.EDF5760: Action research in contemporary educational contexts
all_units.EDF5762: Enhancing education to work transitions and employability
all_units.EDF5763: Promoting and sustaining social and emotional learning in educational contexts
all_units.EDF5610: Interacting with research in education contexts
all_units.EDF5611: Investigating education issues in global contexts

requirement_groups.description: You must complete the following units, and 12 credit points of approved Level 5 units from select Faculty of Education graduate coursework programs.

requirement_groups.title: Pathway to graduate research (optional)
requirement_groups.description:
A pathway to graduate research (e.g. master by research, PhD) is available if you achieve a weighted average mark (WAM) of at least 75% in the units of this course.

If you are completing this pathway, you will need to make the following unit substitutions:
EDF5613 Research approaches in education (12 credit points) to replace EDF5778 Research project in inclusive education and applied behaviour analysis (12 credit points) (Part B) EDF5614 Research project in education (12 credit points) to replace 12 credit points of approved Level 5 units from select Faculty of Education graduate coursework programs (Part C).

Note: This pathway is not available at the point of entry; your eligibility to undertake this pathway will be checked prior to the commencement of EDF5613; if you are commencing at entry level 1 or 2, you must take the required two units in the final semester of your studies; and if you are commencing at entry level 3, you must transfer into the general education studies specialisation.

If you are completing this pathway, you must complete the following units.

requirement_groups.title: MATSENG05 - Complete Requirements
requirement_groups.description: Complete all requirements for Materials engineering

requirement_groups.title: Materials engineering technical electives
requirement_groups.description:
When choosing your electives, it is important to select only from your specialisation technical electives list. This ensures that your elective studies align with and contribute to the knowledge and skills required within your chosen field of study. However, there are additional options available to you:

Option 1: You may use your electives to complete a complementary engineering minor that is available with your specialisation. This allows you to further enhance your knowledge and skills in a specific area of engineering that complements your main field of study.

Option 2: You may consider engineering technical units listed across the engineering minors, subject to meeting the unit prerequisite or co-requisite rules. This will allow you to tailor your studies and broaden your knowledge within the field of engineering while still aligning with your chosen specialisation.

Notes: To enrol in a Level 5 unit listed below, you must be in your final year and have a weighted average mark (WAM) of 65 or above at the conclusion of 3rd Year.

requirement_groups.title: Students enrolled in the single degree Engineering
requirement_groups.description:
To satisfy course requirements, you must take care to complete the electives at the required unit level.

In Year 2, you must complete 12 credit points of electives which can be Level 1, 2 or 3 units from Engineering or other faculties, subject to meeting the unit enrolment rules. Please ensure that you adhere to the course rules regarding Level 1 units and do not exceed the maximum 60 credit points allowed.

In Years 3 and 4, you must complete 24 credit points of electives which must be Level 3 or 4 units and from your engineering specialisation technical electives list. You may also enrol in up to two Level 5 units in your final year. If you intend to enrol in the Faculty's Master of Engineering post-graduate, completing Level 5 units that are core in the Master's course will reduce the total duration of your Master's study.

requirement_groups.title: Students enrolled in a double degree with Engineering
requirement_groups.description: The 36 credit points of specialisation technical electives, which are typically required in the single degree Engineering course, have already been credited towards the double degree structure. As a result, these units are not a requirement in the double degree courses.

requirement_groups.title: Part D. Professional practice
requirement_groups.description:
Continuous professional development is a crucial part of meeting the Engineers Australia Stage 1 Competency Standard to be a Professional Engineer. You must enrol in ENG0001 in your final year and satisfy the professional development requirements if you are studying at the Clayton campus.

The Engineering Accreditation Council Malaysia have similar industrial training requirements. You must enrol in ENG0002 in the second semester of your third year and complete the industrial training required if you are studying at the Malaysia campus.

Option 1: You may use your electives to complete a complementary engineering minor that is available with your specialisation. This allows you to further enhance your knowledge and skills in a specific area of engineering that complements your main field of study.

Option 2: You may consider engineering technical units listed across the engineering minors, subject to meeting the unit prerequisite or co-requisite rules. This will allow you to tailor your studies and broaden your knowledge within the field of engineering while still aligning with your chosen specialisation.

Level 5 units: To enrol in a Level 5 unit listed below, you must be in your final year and have a weighted average mark (WAM) of 65 or above at the conclusion of 3rd Year.

requirement_groups.title: Students enrolled in the single degree Engineering
requirement_groups.description:
To satisfy course requirements, you must take care to complete the electives at the required unit level.

In Year 2, you must complete 12 credit points of electives which can be Level 1, 2 or 3 units from Engineering or other faculties, subject to meeting the unit enrolment rules. Please ensure that you adhere to the course rules regarding Level 1 units and do not exceed the maximum 60 credit points allowed.

In Years 3 and 4, you must complete 24 credit points of electives which must be Level 3 or 4 units and from your engineering specialisation technical electives list. You may also enrol in up to two Level 5 units in your final year. If you intend to enrol in the Faculty's Master of Engineering post-graduate, completing Level 5 units that are core in the Master's course will reduce the total duration of your Master's study.

requirement_groups.title: Part D. Professional practice
requirement_groups.description:
Continuous professional development is a crucial part of meeting the Engineers Australia Stage 1 Competency Standard to be a Professional Engineer. You must enrol in ENG0001 in your final year and satisfy the professional development requirements if you are studying at the Clayton campus.

The Engineering Accreditation Council Malaysia have similar industrial training requirements. You must enrol in ENG0002 in the second semester of your third year and complete the industrial training required if you are studying at the Malaysia campus.

requirement_groups.title: Students enrolled in a double degree with Engineering
requirement_groups.description: The 36 credit points of specialisation technical electives, which are typically required in the single degree Engineering course, have already been credited towards the double degree structure. As a result, these units are not a requirement in the double degree courses.

requirement_groups.title: MALAYSIA: Important requirement
requirement_groups.description: To fulfil the accreditation requirement of the Engineering Accreditation Council Malaysia (EAC), you must complete [(ECE3051 or MEC3416) and TRC4802].

requirement_groups.title: Robotics and mechatronics engineering technical electives
requirement_groups.description:
When choosing your electives, it is important to select only from your specialisation technical electives list. This ensures that your elective studies align with and contribute to the knowledge and skills required within your chosen field of study. However, there are additional options available to you:

Option 1: You may use your electives to complete a complementary engineering minor that is available with your specialisation. This allows you to further enhance your knowledge and skills in a specific area of engineering that complements your main field of study.

Option 2: You may consider engineering technical units listed across the engineering minors, subject to meeting the unit prerequisite or co-requisite rules. This will allow you to tailor your studies and broaden your knowledge within the field of engineering while still aligning with your chosen specialisation.

Note: To enrol in a Level 5 unit listed below, you must be in your final year and have a weighted average mark (WAM) of 65 or above at the conclusion of 3rd Year.

requirement_groups.title: Students enrolled in the single degree Engineering
requirement_groups.description:
To satisfy course requirements, you must take care to complete the electives at the required unit level.

In Year 2, you must complete 12 credit points of electives which can be Level 1, 2 or 3 units from Engineering or other faculties, subject to meeting the unit enrolment rules. Please ensure that you adhere to the course rules regarding Level 1 units and do not exceed the maximum 60 credit points allowed.

In Years 3 and 4, you must complete 24 credit points of electives which must be Level 3 or 4 units and from your engineering specialisation technical electives list. You may also enrol in up to two Level 5 units in your final year. If you intend to enrol in the Faculty's Master of Engineering post-graduate, completing Level 5 units that are core in the Master's course will reduce the total duration of your Master's study.

requirement_groups.title: Studying E3011 Bachelor of Engineering (Honours)/Bachelor of Information Technology - IMPORTANT INFORMATION
requirement_groups.description: Due to content overlap, you replace FIT3171 with an additional Level 3 or 4 approved elective from Part E. Software engineering technical electives.

requirement_groups.title: FIT4042 - Industry-based learning (IBL) placement program
requirement_groups.description: In Year 2, you may apply for selection into the Faculty of Information Technology's industry-based learning (IBL) placement program. FIT4042 is an 18 credit point placement unit that is completed in Semester 2 of Year 3 in the standard progression map. If selected for the program, you enrol in FIT4042 which replaces FIT4002 and a 6 credit point software engineering technical elective.

requirement_groups.title: Part C. Software engineering knowledge and application
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete the following core software engineering units AND one unit at Level 4 or 5 from the software engineering technical electives list.

Note 1: If you are selected for the Faculty of Information Technology Industry-based Learning (IBL) placement program, you will complete FIT4042 in place of FIT4002.

requirement_groups.title: Software engineering technical electives
requirement_groups.description: When choosing your electives, it is important to select only from your specialisation technical electives list. This ensures that your elective studies align with and contribute to the knowledge and skills required within your chosen field of study.

requirement_groups.title: Students enrolled in the single degree Engineering
requirement_groups.description:
To satisfy course requirements, you must take care to complete the electives at the required unit level.

In Year 2, you must complete 12 credit points of electives which can be Level 1, 2 or 3 units from Engineering or other faculties, subject to meeting the unit enrolment rules. Please ensure that you adhere to the course rules regarding Level 1 units and do not exceed the maximum 60 credit points allowed.

In Years 3 and 4, you must complete 24 credit points of electives which must be Level 3 or 4 units and from your engineering specialisation technical electives list. You may also enrol in up to two Level 5 units in your final year. If you intend to enrol in the Faculty's Master of Engineering post-graduate, completing Level 5 units that are core in the Master's course will reduce the total duration of your Master's study.

requirement_groups.title: Students enrolled in a double degree with Engineering
requirement_groups.description: The 36 credit points of specialisation technical electives, which are typically required in the single degree Engineering course, have already been credited towards the double degree structure. As a result, these units are not a requirement in the double degree courses.

requirement_groups.title: Part D. Professional practice
requirement_groups.description:
Continuous professional development is a crucial part of meeting the Engineers Australia Stage 1 Competency Standard to be a Professional Engineer. You must enrol in ENG0001 in your final year and satisfy the professional development requirements if you are studying at the Clayton campus.

The Engineering Accreditation Council Malaysia have similar industrial training requirements. You must enrol in ENG0002 in the second semester of your third year and complete the industrial training required if you are studying at the Malaysia campus.
